title: Quiz 3 - Ratio and Proportion
instruction: In the given questions some values are missing and you are provided with three pair of choices. You have to find which values match with the given choices.

quiz.text: The number of applications accepted from Non-technical posts is 1016. Then, find the number of duplicate applicant’s duplicate applications.
options: 154
145
138
148
None of the above

quiz.text: For the Officer post, if the ratio of the number of male rejected applications to that of females is 4:5. Find the number of female applications accepted, if the ratio of the total number of male applications received to that of females is 3:4?
options: 420
400
360
300
340

quiz.text: For the clerk post, 716 applications were accepted. The ratio of the number of duplicate applicants to the average number of applications received from duplicate applicants is 3:5. Find the difference between the number of duplicate applicants and the average number of applications received from duplicate applicants?
options: 18
6
12
9
None of the above

quiz.text: Average number of duplicate applications received from the Manager and assistant manager is 15, then find the number of rejected applications is what percent of the number of received applications for assistant manager post.
options: 13%
17%
7%
2%
9%

quiz.text: For a manager post, If the ratio of the number of applications received to the number of applications rejected is 5:1.Find the number of applications accepted is how much more or less than the number of rejected?
options: 240 less
540 more
240 more
240 more
150 more

quiz.text: The Solar Plants in village A in 1st week are operating at efficiency such that 300 houses get electricity for only 16 hours. What is the efficiency at which it is working and how much more electricity should be produced for 24 hours electricity in all houses? (approximately)
options: 58.33%, 3,58,456
55.55%, 4,26,667
65.66%, 4,87,554
53.33%, 4,54,788
61.88%, 4,78,123

quiz.text: Total electricity produced in village B in 1st and 2nd week at 75% and 90% efficiency respectively is what percentage of electricityproduced in C in 3rd and 4th weeks at 80% of maximum efficiency respectively?
options: 28.66%
31.675%
22%
25.3125%
None of these

quiz.text: What is the ratio of units consumed in village A and B in four weeks at full efficiency to the ratio of units consumed in village C and D in the same period at full efficiency?
options: 81:154
23:45
17:23
19:33
None of these

quiz.text: Due to a storm in village D in week 4th, 3 Solar Plants stopped working while 5 Solar Plants began working at 45% efficiency. How much efficiency should the rest of the Solar Plants start working so that houses remain light for at least 12 hours and what is the average electricity produced by each functional Solar Plant?
options: 87.5%, 1.5 lakh units
90.33%, 1.45 lakh units
93.75%, 1.33 lakh units
95.50%, 1.2 lakh units
None of these

quiz.text: Fill in the following blanks with the data given in options: The electricity produced by Solar Plants in A in 2nd week at 90% efficiency lights up all the houses for __ hrs a day and is __% more than electricity produced in D in 1st week at full efficiency.
options: 19 hrs, 23.33%
21.6 hrs, 35%
18 hrs, 33.33%
17 hrs, 37.7%
None of the above

quiz.text: Quantity I: Age of Veer, Ramya and Alok is in ratio 12:16:15. 6 years ago, Ramya’s age was twice of Alok’s brother’s age at that time. Veer is 5 years elder to Alok’s brother. What is the present age of Alok?   Quantity II: The ratio of ages of A and B is 4:5 and that of C and D is also 4:5. 10 years ago, the ratio of age of A and C was 7:5 and that of B and D was 4:3. What is the average age of A, B, C and D 10 years from now?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: 8 years ago, a father was thrice as old as his son. Two years back, the boy was 1 ¼ times older than his sister. If the ratio of age of the father, son and daughter two years hence is 13:6:5, what is the average present age of the father, son and daughter?   Quantity II:
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: In the income statement of Asha and Ravenna, the ratio of their income in the year 2017 was 5 : 4. The ratio of Asha’s income in the year 2018 to that in 2017 is 3 : 5 and the ratio of Ravenna’s income in the year 2018 to that in 2017 is 3 : 2. If Rs. 10242 is the sum of the income of Asha and Ravenna in the year 2018, then find the income of Ravenna in the year 2017?   Quantity II: The average score in an examination taken by 52 students of a class is 85. If the scores of the best 5 performers are not considered, the average score of the remaining students falls by 2. If, none of the first five highest scorers is not below 80 and if each of the 5 top scorers had distinct integral scores, find the maximum possible score of the topper.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: A father distributed some chocolates among his four children and kept some with him. The eldest three children got chocolates in the ratio 3 : 11 : 7. The total number of chocolates with father and youngest child is three times the total chocolates with the three eldest children. The ratio of chocolates with father and that with all the children is 3 : 4. Find the total number of chocolates if the youngest child has 81 chocolates with him?

 

Quantity II: x. Where
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: A bag contains certain number of coins of different denominations. The ratio of the number of Rs. 1 coins to Rs. 2 coins is 5 : 7, respectively and the ratio of number of Rs. 2 coins to Rs. 5 coins is 7 : 6 respectively. If the total value of the Rs. 5 coins is , if the total value of the Rs. 1 coins in the bag is Rs. 15. Then which of the following statement(s) is/are true? I:  is not a prime number II: III: Is  a unitary perfect number
options: Only II
Only III
Both I and II
All I, II and III
Both II and III

quiz.text: Sumit hired a travelling car for a tour. If the car is rented for 8 hours or less the charge is Rs. 100 per hour or Rs. 8 per km whichever is more. On the other hand, if the car is rented for more than 8 hours, the charge is Rs. 80 per hour or Rs. 6 per km whichever is more. Sumit used the car for 120 km and paid Rs. 800. If the hours he took the car for rent is . Then which of the following statement(s) is/are true? I: II: III:
options: Only I
Only III
Both II and III
Both I and II
None of these

quiz.text:
Two vessels A and B of equal volume contain milk and water in the ratio 3 : 2 and 2 : 1 to their brim respectively. Two litres of the solution from vessel A and three litres of the solution from vessel B are poured into a big empty vessel C. If the solution in C occupied 40% of the capacity of C, in which of the following statement(s) is/are should the proportion of the volume of vessel C should be the volume of water that shall be added so that the ratio of milk and water in vessel C becomes 1 : 1?

I: 

II:

III: 0.153
options: Both I and II
Only I
Only II
Both II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text:
In class X of a school there are two sections A and B with strength ratio 2:1. The ratio of boys and girls in section A is 3 : 1 and that in section B is 3 : 5. Students of both the sections are made to stand in the ground in rows of boys and girls, with each row having equal number of students. If the maximum number of students possible in a row is 96 what is the difference between the number of boys in section A and B?

I:

II:

III:
options: Both I and II
Both II and III
Both I and III
Only I
Only II

quiz.text: What is the age of the mother of Rohit? Statement I: The age of Rohit’s father is 3 times more than age of Rohit. After 4 years the ratio of age of Rohit and his father becomes 1: 3 and the age of mother is 4 years less than the age of his father. Statement II: The ratio of age of Rohit and his mother is 2 : 7 and before 4 years the age of Rohit and his mother 1 : 6.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question
If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Sum of ages of Julia, Rani, Amelia and Sonia is 91. What is the present age of Amelia? 

Statement I : Ratio of ages of Sonia and Julia 6 years ago was 9 : 7. 

Statement II : Ratio of ages of Julia and Amelia after 10 years will be 6 : 7.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question
If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
If two taps, T1 and T2 are opened simultaneously, how long would it take for the empty tank to be filled to 50% of its capacity?

Statement I : T1 can fill the empty tank in 12 hours. 

 

Statement II : T2 can empty 50% the tank in 10 hours.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question
If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: The ratio of salary of A and B is 5 : 7 and that of B and C is 3 : 5. The salary of A is Rs. 165000 and C spends ___% of his salary on rent. ___ money is left with C after expenditure on rent? I: 18.75, Rs. 3,12,812.5 II: 22.22, Rs. 3,15,000 III: 28.56, Rs. 2,75,000
options: Only I
Only II
Both I and III
Both II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: The ratio of marks obtained by Shubham in theory to the total marks which can be obtained in theory is 7 : 10. Total marks which can be obtained in practical’s were ___% of the total marks of theory. If Shubham got full marks in practical then ___ is the ratio of total marks obtained by Shubham to the total marks which can be obtained in the subject (theory + practical). I: 20, 3:4 II: 30, 5:7 III: 40, 11:14
options: Only I
Both I and II
Both I and III
Only II
All I, II and III

quiz.text: The sum of the three numbers is 527. If the ratio of the first to second is ___ and that of the second to the third is 5:3 , then the second number is? I: 2:3, 232.5 II: 3:2, 170 III: 4:1, 175
options: Only I
Only II
Both I and III
Both I and II
All I, II and III

quiz.text: A sum of money is to be distributed among P, Q, R, and S in the proportion 2:5:6:7, If R gets Rs. ___ less than S. What is the average of the share received by P, Q and R? Also, find the total amount that is distributed among them. I: 350, 1517.67, 7,000 II: 200, 866.67, 4,500 III: 500, 2166.67, 10,000
options: Only III
Only II
Both I and III
Both I and II
Both II and III
